channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large pothole forming between Staverton and Ashville on B4063, just before the commerce road traffic lights., 6th December
item.description:
In addition to the very large pothole closer towards the staverton junction that I believe has already been reported, this one is further along, towards Churchdown, on the left, opposite the airfield, just before the junction for the ambulance station (commerce road).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water coming from repaired pothole, suggesting damage to buried pipework under the road surface. This poses a danger of ice in current cold weather and needs fixing urgently, 6th December
item.description:
On Paynes Pitch, outside no.13, in the road surface
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paynes Pitch, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Enormous hole in road, 6th December
item.description:
B4063. Travelling from GCHQ, past bamfurlong lane traffic lights towards Dowty. Approx 50m past the traffic lights on the left hand side of the road is a big crater. Will need to have wheel inspected as almost certainly caused serious damage!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking and turning on pavement and verge., 6th December
item.description:
People are doing 180 degree turns on the verge / pavement here as they collect their post from the boxes located there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Caernarvon Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Street Drain Blocked, 6th December
item.description:

item.title: Water pouring down the lane from a hole in the road, 6th December
item.description:
Bushcombe Lane Woodmancote directly outside West Ridge. A significant amount of water is pouring from the hole and flooding the lane. It has increased dramatically over the last few days but has been there for weeks (previously reported) If temperatures drop this will be extremely dangerous!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Lane, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same
